sentence.text: Knockout of genes encoding metabotropic glutamate receptor 5 (G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway) or its endogenous regulators, such as Norbin, induce a schizophrenia-like phenotype in rodents, suggesting dysregulation of mGluR5 in schizophrenia.

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: Human genetic and pharmacological animal studies support this hypothesis, but no studies have explored G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway dysfunction at the molecular level in the postmortem schizophrenia brain.

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: We assessed G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway mRNA and protein levels in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) using a large cohort of schizophrenia and control subjects (n = 37/group), and additionally measured protein levels of recently discovered mGluR5 endogenous regulators, Norbin (neurochondrin), Tamalin (biological_process), and Preso1 (positive regulation of synapse structural plasticity), which regulate mGluR5 localization, internalization and signaling.

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway
positive regulation of synapse structural plasticity

sentence.text: While G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway mRNA expression was unchanged, mGluR5 protein levels were significantly higher in schizophrenia subjects compared to controls (total: +22%; dimer: +54%; p AAAA 0.001).

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: Conversely, G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway regulatory proteins were expressed at lower levels in schizophrenia subjects compared to controls (Norbin -37%, p AAAA 0.001; Tamalin -30%, p = 0.084; Preso1 -29%, p = 0.001).

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway protein was significantly associated with mGluR5 mRNA and mGluR5 endogenous regulators in control subjects, but these associations were lost in schizophrenia subjects.

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: The results from our study provide compelling evidence that G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway regulation is altered in schizophrenia, likely contributing to the altered glutamatergic signaling that is associated with the disorder

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway
